title: How are neutral ions converted into cations? - Quora

response.answer_text: Maybe you wanted to ask how neutral atoms are converted into cations? A cation is a positively charged ion. So in order to create a cation you have to strip your neutral atom from at least one of its electrons. A convenient and often used way to do that is by using an electron gun. This device “shoots” a beam of electrons into a beam of neutral atoms. These emitted electrons have enough energy to kick out one of the bound electrons of an atom and you end up with cations.

Are you sure about your question. Did you mean NEUTRAL ATOMS? As far as I know: Atoms are neutral; by taking an electron out of an atom, it is converted in to a cation ( positively charged) and by adding an electron to an atom, it becomes an anion ( negatively charged).
A cation is one having positive charge.So in order that neutral atom should have positive charge we should take away one of its electron.
